returns.description: An array of all currently running applications

Fetch the first running application that matches a name

- Returns: The first matching application, or nil if none matched

returns.description: The first matching application, or nil if none matched

methods.name: pathForBundleID
methods.rawDocumentation:
Fetch the filesystem path for an application
- Parameter bundleID: The application bundle identifier to search for (e.g. "com.apple.Safari")
- Returns: The application's filesystem path, or nil if it was not found
methods.description: Fetch the filesystem path for an application

params.name: bundleID
params.description: The application bundle identifier to search for (e.g. "com.apple.Safari")

returns.description: The application's filesystem path, or nil if it was not found

methods.name: pathsForBundleID
methods.rawDocumentation:
Fetch filesystem paths for an application
- Parameter bundleID: The application bundle identifier to search for (e.g. "com.apple.Safari")
- Returns: An array of strings containing any filesystem paths that were found
methods.description: Fetch filesystem paths for an application

params.name: bundleID
params.description: The application bundle identifier to search for (e.g. "com.apple.Safari")

returns.description: An array of strings containing any filesystem paths that were found

methods.name: pathForFileType
methods.rawDocumentation:
Fetch filesystem path for an application able to open a given file type
- Parameter fileType: The file type to search for. This can be a UTType identifier, a MIME type, or a filename extension
- Returns: The path to an application for the given filetype, or il if none were found
methods.description: Fetch filesystem path for an application able to open a given file type

params.name: fileType
params.description: The file type to search for. This can be a UTType identifier, a MIME type, or a filename extension

returns.description: The path to an application for the given filetype, or il if none were found

methods.name: pathsForFileType
methods.rawDocumentation:
Fetch filesystem paths for applications able to open a given file type
- Parameter fileType: The file type to search for. This can be a UTType identifier, a MIME type, or a filename extension
- Returns: An array of strings containing the filesystem paths for any applications that were found
methods.description: Fetch filesystem paths for applications able to open a given file type

params.name: fileType
params.description: The file type to search for. This can be a UTType identifier, a MIME type, or a filename extension

returns.description: An array of strings containing the filesystem paths for any applications that were found

methods.name: launchOrFocus
methods.rawDocumentation:
Launch an application, or give it focus if it's already running

methods.description: Launch an application, or give it focus if it's already running

params.name: bundleID
params.description: A bundle identifier for the app to launch/focus (e.g. "com.apple.Safari")

methods.name: addWatcher
methods.rawDocumentation:
Create a watcher for application events
- Parameters:
- event: The event type to listen for
- listener: A javascript function/lambda to call when the event is received. The function will be called with two parameters: the name of the event, and the associated HSApplication object
methods.description: Create a watcher for application events

params.name: event
params.description: The event type to listen for

params.name: listener
params.description: A javascript function/lambda to call when the event is received. The function will be called with two parameters: the name of the event, and the associated HSApplication object

methods.name: removeWatcher
methods.rawDocumentation:
Remove a watcher for application events
- Parameters:
- event: The event type to stop listening for
- listener: The javascript function/lambda that was previously being used to handle the event
methods.description: Remove a watcher for application events

params.name: event
params.description: The event type to stop listening for

params.name: listener
params.description: The javascript function/lambda that was previously being used to handle the event

methods.name: addWatcher
methods.rawDocumentation:
Add a watcher for application AX events
Parameters:
- application: An HSApplication object
- notification: An event name
- listener: A function/lambda to be called when the event is fired. The function/lambda will be called with two arguments: the name of the event, and the element it applies to
methods.description: Add a watcher for application AX events

params.name: application
params.description: An HSApplication object

params.name: notification
params.description: An event name

params.name: listener
params.description: A function/lambda to be called when the event is fired. The function/lambda will be called with two arguments: the name of the event, and the element it applies to

methods.name: removeWatcher
methods.rawDocumentation:
Remove a watcher for application AX events
Parameters:
- application: An HSApplication object
- notification: The event name to stop watching
- listener: The function/lambda provided when adding the watcher
methods.description: Remove a watcher for application AX events

params.name: application
params.description: An HSApplication object

params.name: notification
params.description: The event name to stop watching

params.name: listener
params.description: The function/lambda provided when adding the watcher

params.name: title
params.description: The name to search for

params.name: parent
params.description: An HSAXElement object to search. If none is supplied, the search will be conducted system-wide

returns.description: An array of found elements

modules.description: # Accessibility API Module ## Basic Usage ```js // Get the focused UI element const element = hs.ax.focusedElement(); console.log(element.role, element.title); // Watch for window creation events const app = hs.application.frontmost(); hs.ax.addWatcher(app, "AXWindowCreated", (notification, element) => { console.log("New window:", element.title); }); ``` **Note:** Requires accessibility permissions in System Preferences.

modules.name: hs.hotkey

methods.name: bind
methods.signature: func bind(_ mods: JSValue, _ key: String, _ callbackPressed: JSValue, _ callbackReleased: JSValue) -> HSHotkey?
methods.rawDocumentation:
Bind a hotkey
- Parameters:
- mods: An array of modifier key strings (e.g., ["cmd", "shift"])
- key: The key name or character (e.g., "a", "space", "return")
- callbackPressed: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is pressed
- callbackReleased: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is released
- Returns: A hotkey object, or nil if binding failed
methods.description: Bind a hotkey

params.name: mods
params.description: An array of modifier key strings (e.g., ["cmd", "shift"])

params.name: key
params.description: The key name or character (e.g., "a", "space", "return")

params.name: callbackPressed
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is pressed

params.name: callbackReleased
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is released

returns.description: A hotkey object, or nil if binding failed

methods.name: bindSpec
methods.signature: func bindSpec(_ mods: JSValue, _ key: String, _ message: String?, _ callbackPressed: JSValue, _ callbackReleased: JSValue) -> HSHotkey?
methods.rawDocumentation:
Bind a hotkey with a message description
- Parameters:
- mods: An array of modifier key strings
- key: The key name or character
- message: A description of what this hotkey does (currently unused, for future features)
- callbackPressed: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is pressed
- callbackReleased: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is released
- Returns: A hotkey object, or nil if binding failed
methods.description: Bind a hotkey with a message description

params.name: mods
params.description: An array of modifier key strings

params.name: key
params.description: The key name or character

params.name: message
params.description: A description of what this hotkey does (currently unused, for future features)

params.name: callbackPressed
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is pressed

params.name: callbackReleased
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the hotkey is released

returns.description: A hotkey object, or nil if binding failed

methods.name: new
methods.signature: func new(_ interval: TimeInterval, _ callback: JSValue, _ continueOnError: Bool) -> HSTimer
methods.rawDocumentation:
Create a new timer
- Parameters:
- interval: The interval in seconds at which the timer should fire
- callback: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires
- continueOnError: If true, the timer will continue running even if the callback throws an error
- Returns: A timer object. Call start() to begin the timer.
methods.description: Create a new timer

params.name: interval
params.description: The interval in seconds at which the timer should fire

params.name: callback
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires

params.name: continueOnError
params.description: If true, the timer will continue running even if the callback throws an error

returns.description: A timer object. Call start() to begin the timer.

methods.name: doAfter
methods.signature: func doAfter(_ seconds: TimeInterval, _ callback: JSValue) -> HSTimer
methods.rawDocumentation:
Create and start a one-shot timer
- Parameters:
- seconds: Number of seconds to wait before firing
- callback: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires
- Returns: A timer object (already started)
methods.description: Create and start a one-shot timer

params.name: seconds
params.description: Number of seconds to wait before firing

params.name: callback
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires

returns.description: A timer object (already started)

methods.name: doEvery
methods.signature: func doEvery(_ interval: TimeInterval, _ callback: JSValue) -> HSTimer
methods.rawDocumentation:
Create and start a repeating timer
- Parameters:
- interval: The interval in seconds at which the timer should fire
- callback: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires
- Returns: A timer object (already started)
methods.description: Create and start a repeating timer

params.name: interval
params.description: The interval in seconds at which the timer should fire

params.name: callback
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires

returns.description: A timer object (already started)

methods.name: doAt
methods.signature: func doAt(_ time: TimeInterval, _ repeatInterval: TimeInterval, _ callback: JSValue, _ continueOnError: Bool) -> HSTimer
methods.rawDocumentation:
Create and start a timer that fires at a specific time
- Parameters:
- time: Seconds since midnight (local time) when the timer should first fire
- repeatInterval: If provided, the timer will repeat at this interval. Pass 0 for one-shot.
- callback: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires
- continueOnError: If true, the timer will continue running even if the callback throws an error
- Returns: A timer object (already started)
methods.description: Create and start a timer that fires at a specific time

params.name: time
params.description: Seconds since midnight (local time) when the timer should first fire

params.name: repeatInterval
params.description: If provided, the timer will repeat at this interval. Pass 0 for one-shot.

params.name: callback
params.description: A JavaScript function to call when the timer fires

params.name: continueOnError
params.description: If true, the timer will continue running even if the callback throws an error

returns.description: A timer object (already started)

methods.name: usleep
methods.rawDocumentation:
Block execution for a specified number of microseconds (strongly discouraged)
- Parameter microseconds: Number of microseconds to sleep
- Note: This blocks the entire application and should be avoided. Use timers instead.
methods.description: Block execution for a specified number of microseconds (strongly discouraged)

params.name: microseconds
params.description: Number of microseconds to sleep

methods.name: seconds
methods.rawDocumentation: SKIP_DOCS
methods.description: SKIP_DOCS

methods.name: doUntil
methods.rawDocumentation:
Repeat a function/lambda until a given predicate function/lambda returns true
Parameters:
- predicateFn: A function/lambda to test if the timer should continue. Return True to end the timer, False to continue it
- actionFn: A function/lambda to call until the predicateFn returns true
- checkInterval: How often, in seconds, to call actionFn
methods.description: Repeat a function/lambda until a given predicate function/lambda returns true

params.name: predicateFn
params.description: A function/lambda to test if the timer should continue. Return True to end the timer, False to continue it

params.name: actionFn
params.description: A function/lambda to call until the predicateFn returns true

params.name: checkInterval
params.description: How often, in seconds, to call actionFn

methods.name: doWhile
methods.rawDocumentation:
Repeat a function/lambda while a given predicate function/lambda returns true
Parameters:
- predicateFn: A function/lambda to test if the timer should continue. Return True to continue the timer, False to end it
- actionFn: A function/lambda to call while the predicateFn returns true
- checkInterval: How often, in seconds, to call actionFn
methods.description: Repeat a function/lambda while a given predicate function/lambda returns true

params.name: predicateFn
params.description: A function/lambda to test if the timer should continue. Return True to continue the timer, False to end it

params.name: actionFn
params.description: A function/lambda to call while the predicateFn returns true

params.name: checkInterval
params.description: How often, in seconds, to call actionFn

methods.name: waitUntil
methods.rawDocumentation:
Wait to call a function/lambda until a given predicate function/lambda returns true
Parameters:
- predicateFn: A function/lambda to test if the actionFn should be called. Return True to call the actionFn, False to continue waiting
- actionFn: A function/lambda to call when the predicateFn returns true. This will only be called once and then the timer will stop.
- checkInterval: How often, in seconds, to call predicateFn
methods.description: Wait to call a function/lambda until a given predicate function/lambda returns true

params.name: predicateFn
params.description: A function/lambda to test if the actionFn should be called. Return True to call the actionFn, False to continue waiting

params.name: actionFn
params.description: A function/lambda to call when the predicateFn returns true. This will only be called once and then the timer will stop.

params.name: checkInterval
params.description: How often, in seconds, to call predicateFn

methods.name: waitWhile
methods.rawDocumentation:
Wait to call a function/lambda until a given predicate function/lambda returns false
Parameters:
- predicateFn: A function/lambda to test if the actionFn should be called. Return False to call the actionFn, True to continue waiting
- actionFn: A function/lambda to call when the predicateFn returns False. This will only be called once and then the timer will stop.
- checkInterval: How often, in seconds, to call predicateFn
methods.description: Wait to call a function/lambda until a given predicate function/lambda returns false

params.name: predicateFn
params.description: A function/lambda to test if the actionFn should be called. Return False to call the actionFn, True to continue waiting

params.name: actionFn
params.description: A function/lambda to call when the predicateFn returns False. This will only be called once and then the timer will stop.

params.name: checkInterval
params.description: How often, in seconds, to call predicateFn

methods.name: delayed
methods.rawDocumentation: SKIP_DOCS
methods.description: SKIP_DOCS

returns.description: Seconds until next trigger, or a negative value if the timer is not running

params.description: Number of seconds from now when the timer should fire

types.name: HSFontAPI
types.rawDocumentation: This is a JavaScript object used to represent macOS fonts. It includes a variety of static methods that can instantiate the various font sizes commonly used with UI elements, and also includes static methods for instantiating the system font at various sizes/weights, or any custom font available on the system.
types.description: This is a JavaScript object used to represent macOS fonts. It includes a variety of static methods that can instantiate the various font sizes commonly used with UI elements, and also includes static methods for instantiating the system font at various sizes/weights, or any custom font available on the system.

types.name: HSPointAPI
types.rawDocumentation: This is a JavaScript object used to represent coordinates, or "points", as used in various places throughout Hammerspoon's API, particularly where dealing with positions on a screen. Behind the scenes it is a wrapper for the CGPoint type in Swift/ObjectiveC.
types.description: This is a JavaScript object used to represent coordinates, or "points", as used in various places throughout Hammerspoon's API, particularly where dealing with positions on a screen. Behind the scenes it is a wrapper for the CGPoint type in Swift/ObjectiveC.

types.name: HSRectAPI
types.rawDocumentation: This is a JavaScript object used to represent a rectangle, as used in various places throughout Hammerspoon's API, particularly where dealing with portions of a display. Behind the scenes it is a wrapper for the CGRect type in Swift/ObjectiveC.
